title.narrative: Provision of Shelter and NFIs Assistance to IDPs in response to New Arrivals in Kaga and Decongestion of Camps in Monguno Local Government Area.

description.narrative:
UNHCR continues to effectively respond to emergency needs in North-East Nigeria, to address gaps identified by the Shelter amp DMS/CCCM Displacement through the provision of Protection, Shelter/NFI and CCCM. This project will target IDPs in response to new arrivals to support urgent and critical needs in accordance with the 90-Days Emergency Response Plan, and in line with the Humanitarian Response Plan through the provision of 600 emergency shelters Bama type and 600 improved NFI kits to newly displaced IDPs in Maiduguri LGAs. In 2019, UNHCR responded to shelter needs of IDPs in Borno state, by providing a total of 510 HHs to a total of 2550 individuals who benefitted from shelter assistance in formal camp (Stadium) in Maiduguri under the NHF standard allocation. The beneficiaries of the assistance were mostly displaced persons originating from Kukawa, Monguno axis who had been been without shelter in the Teacher’s village camp. UNHCR also provided shelter assistance to IDPs and Refugee returnees earlier this year to 100 HHs in Pulka Gwoza LGA of Borno State. As the number of new arrivals and congestions in camps increases due to military operations in Monguno, Kukawa, Bama, Ngala and Gwoza LGAs, there is need to provide emergency shelters and NFIs for life-saving emergency assistance. Subsequently acknowledging that the humanitarian situation is likely to further deteriorate UNHCR will scale-up its activities to promote the protection, safety and dignity of affected Persons of Concern (PoCs).
Despite the achievements in the past, the continuous needs of IDPs, though shaped by very different dynamics, have continued to grow, due to the unabating spiral of violence, pushing more and more people in very congested camps. The inadequate support to IDPs and lack of spacious land is likely to scale up the number of IDP’s hosted within the existing camps, consequently reducing the number of emergency shelters available to cover both the needs of new arrivals and to decongest the camps.
UNHCR shall build upon progress being made in 2019 and proposes, under this action the 1. Provision of 600 emergency shelters Bama type (600 households) to new arrivals in Maiduguri. 2. Provision of 600 improved NFI kits The selection of beneficiaries will be based on needs assessment and vulnerability screening in the locations at the time of implementation. Identification and verification of beneficiaries are guided by UNHCR’s Protection principles.
